name: df-prjsp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cprjsp, cmpt(s0, clvec, csb(s1, cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), cqs(cv(s1), copab(s2, s3, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s3), cv(s1))), wrex(s4, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s3))))))))))
comment: Define the projective space function. In the bijection between 3D lines through the origin and points in the projective plane (see section comment), this is equivalent to making any two 3D points (excluding the origin) equivalent iff one is a multiple of another. This definition does not quite give all the properties needed, since the scalars of a left vector space can be "less dense" than the vectors (for example, equivocating rational multiples of real numbers). (Contributed by BJ and Steven Nguyen, 29-Apr-2023.)
